com.defano.jmonet.tools.base

Class SelectionTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.defano.jmonet.tools.base.BasicTool<SelectionToolDelegate>
      • com.defano.jmonet.tools.base.SelectionTool
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CanvasCommitObserver, SurfaceInteractionObserver, Tool, MutableSelection, Selection, MarchingAntsObserver, KeyListener, EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LassoTool, MarqueeTool, RotateTool, TransformTool

    public class SelectionTool
extends BasicTool<SelectionToolDelegate>
implements CanvasCommitObserver, MarchingAntsObserver, MutableSelection, SurfaceInteractionObserver
    A complex tool that draws a bounding shape (typically a rectangle, but may be any closed shape) and provides the ability to pick up and move or transform the pixels bound by the selection shape.

      • createSelection

        public void createSelection(Rectangle bounds)
        Creates a selection bounded by the given rectangle. Equivalent to the user clicking and dragging from the top- left to the bottom-right of bounds.
        Parameters:
        bounds - The selection rectangle to create.

      • createSelection

        public void createSelection(BufferedImage image,
                            Point location)
        Creates a selection containing the given image at the requested location on the canvas. The size of the selection will equal the bounds of the given image.
        Parameters:
        image - The image contained by the selection. Note that the selection bounds will equal the bounds of this image.
        location - The location on the canvas where the selection (and image) will initially appear.

      • mouseDragged

        public void mouseDragged(MouseEvent e,
                         Point canvasLoc)
        Invoked when a mouse button is pressed on a component and then dragged. MOUSE_DRAGGED events will continue to be delivered to the component where the drag originated until the mouse button is released (regardless of whether the mouse position is within the bounds of the component).

        Due to platform-dependent Drag&Drop implementations, MOUSE_DRAGGED events may not be delivered during a native Drag&Drop operation.

        Specified by:
        mouseDragged in interface SurfaceInteractionObserver
        Parameters:
        e - The mouse event that occurred
        canvasLoc - The location (relative to the canvas) where the event occurred, taking into account scale, grid and scroll pane complications as appropriate.

        Parameters:

        canvasLoc - The location (relative to the canvas) where the event occurred, taking into account scale, grid and scroll pane complications as appropriate.

      • activate

        public void activate(PaintCanvas canvas)
        Activates this tool on a given canvas.

        A paint tool does not "paint" on the canvas until it is activated. Typically, only one tool is active on a canvas at any given time, but there is no technical limitation preventing multiple tools from being active at once. While a canvas may have multiple active tools drawing on it, a tool can only be active on a single canvas.

        Use Tool.deactivate() to stop this tool from painting on the canvas.

        Specified by:
        activate in interface Tool
        Overrides:
        activate in class BasicTool<SelectionToolDelegate>
        Parameters:
        canvas - The paint canvas on which to activate the tool.

      • deactivate

        public void deactivate()
        Deactivates the tool on the canvas. Invoking this method on a tool this is not presently activated has no effect. A deactivated tool no longer affects the canvas and all listeners / observers are un-subscribed making the tool available for garbage collection.
        Specified by:
        deactivate in interface Tool
        Overrides:
        deactivate in class BasicTool<SelectionToolDelegate>

      • morphSelection

        public void morphSelection(SelectionTool to)
        Takes the current selection represented by this tool and transfers it over to the given tool. Note that invoking this method clears the selection from this tool, but does not deactivate the tool from the canvas. In most uses, the caller will want to deactivate this tool immediately after calling this method.

        For example, this allows the user to draw a selection with the lasso tool and then transform it with a transform tool (i.e., PerspectiveTool without having to redefine the selection bounds.

        Parameters:
        to - The tool that the current selection should be transferred to.

      • getSelectedImageObservable

        public io.reactivex.Observable<Optional<BufferedImage>> getSelectedImageObservable()
        Gets an Observable containing the selected image, useful for observing changes made to the selected image.
        Returns:
        The provider.

      • getSelectedImage

        public BufferedImage getSelectedImage()
        Gets the image represented by the selection, or null, if no selection exists.

        Note that a user can select a non-rectangular selection, but the selected image returned by this method will always be a rectangle whose bounds are the smallest rectangle that can fit in the selected shape Any pixels outside the user's selection frame will be fully transparent in the returned image.

        Specified by:
        getSelectedImage in interface Selection
        Returns:
        The selected image

      • setSelectedImage

        public void setSelectedImage(BufferedImage selectedImage)
        Replaces the current selected image with the given image. It is the caller's responsibility to mask the given image to assure it does not exceed the selection bounds.
        Specified by:
        setSelectedImage in interface MutableSelection
        Parameters:
        selectedImage - The image with which to replace the selection.

      • deleteSelection

        public void deleteSelection()
        Deletes the selected image from the canvas, commits the change, then clears the selection (removes marching ants). Has the effect of the user pressing 'delete' when an active selection exists.

      • hasSelection

        public boolean hasSelection()
        Determines if the user has an active selection. A selection exists only after the user has completed defining a closed, selection outline.
        Specified by:
        hasSelection in interface Selection
        Returns:
        True is a selection exists, false otherwise.

      • hasSelectionFrame

        protected boolean hasSelectionFrame()
        Determines if the user has an active selection boundary (i.e., a rectangle of marching ants)

        Differs from hasSelection() in that when a user is dragging the selection rectangle, a selection boundary will exist but a selection will not. The selection is not made until the user releases the mouse.

        Returns:
        True if a selection boundary exists, false otherwise.

      • getSelectionFromCanvas

        protected void getSelectionFromCanvas()
        Make the canvas image bounded by the given selection shape the current selected image. Does not modify the canvas in any way (does not "pick up" the image from the canvas).

      • getSelectionLocation

        public Point getSelectionLocation()
        Determines the location (top-left coordinate) of the selection outline (Selection.getSelectionFrame() on the canvas, relative to the top-left coordinate of the canvas.
        Specified by:
        getSelectionLocation in interface Selection
        Returns:
        Get the top-left coordinate of the selection boundary or null if no selection exists

      • eraseSelectedPixelsFromCanvas

        public void eraseSelectedPixelsFromCanvas()

      • redrawSelection

        public void redrawSelection(boolean includeFrame)
        Clears the scratch buffer and redraws the current state of the selection onto it.
        Specified by:
        redrawSelection in interface Selection
        Parameters:
        includeFrame - When true, draws the selection frame (marching ants) on the buffer; when false, the frame is omitted.

      • getSelectedImageLocation

        protected Point getSelectedImageLocation()
        Returns the location (top-left x,y coordinates) on the canvas where the selected image should be drawn. Typically, this is the location of the selection shape.

        However, for tools that mutate the selection shape (i.e., RotateTool), this location may need to be adjusted to account for changes to the selection shape's bounds.

        Returns:
        The x,y coordinate where the selected image should be drawn on the canvas.

      • drawSelectionFrame

        protected void drawSelectionFrame()
        Renders the selection frame (marching ants) on the canvas.

      • setDirty

        public void setDirty()
        Marks the selection as having been mutated (either by transformation or movement).
        Specified by:
        setDirty in interface MutableSelection

      • isDirty

        protected boolean isDirty()
        Determines if the current selection has been changed or moved in any way since the selection outline was defined.
        Returns:
        True if the selection was changed, false otherwise.

      • onCommit

        public void onCommit(PaintCanvas canvas,
                     ImageLayerSet imageLayerSet,
                     BufferedImage canvasImage)
        Fires when an new shape or image is committed from scratch onto the canvas.
        Specified by:
        onCommit in interface CanvasCommitObserver
        Parameters:
        canvas - The canvas on which the commit is occurring.
        imageLayerSet - The set of changes being committed.
        canvasImage - The resulting canvas image (including the committed change)

      • onAntsMoved

        public void onAntsMoved(Stroke ants)
        Called to indicate that ants have "marched" (the dotted line stroke phase has changed) and that observers should re-paint using the stroke provided.
        Specified by:
        onAntsMoved in interface MarchingAntsObserver
        Parameters:
        ants - The new paint stroke to re-draw.

      • resetSelection

        public void resetSelection()
        Transitions to an un-selected state. Reset the selection boundary to its initial, no-selection state. Selection.getSelectionFrame() should return null following a selection reset, but prior to defining a new selection.
        Specified by:
        resetSelection in interface MutableSelection

      • setSelectionOutline

        public void setSelectionOutline(Shape bounds)
        Specifies the selection rectangle (bounds) of the current selection, i.e., the rectangular path on which "marching ants" will be drawn.
        Specified by:
        setSelectionOutline in interface MutableSelection
        Parameters:
        bounds - The new selection bounds.

      • translateSelection

        public void translateSelection(int xDelta,
                               int yDelta)
        Invoked to indicate that the selection should be moved on the canvas and therefore the selection shape's coordinates should be translated accordingly.
        Specified by:
        translateSelection in interface MutableSelection
        Parameters:
        xDelta - Number of pixels to move selection bounds horizontally.
        yDelta - Number of pixels to move selection bounds vertically.

      • getSelectionFrame

        public Shape getSelectionFrame()
        Gets the current selection outline's shape and location, i.e., the path on the canvas where "marching ants" will be drawn.

        Note that the location of the shape's bounds is translated to the selection's location on the canvas. Use Selection.getIdentitySelectionFrame() for a selection outline located at (0, 0) and suitable for testing whether a pixel in the selected image is within the selection shape's mask.

        Specified by:
        getSelectionFrame in interface Selection
        Returns:
        The selection outline's shape and location on the canvas

      • getMovementCursor

        public Cursor getMovementCursor()
        Gets the cursor used to drag or move the selection on the canvas.
        Returns:
        The movement cursor

      • setMovementCursor

        public void setMovementCursor(Cursor movementCursor)
        Sets the cursor used when dragging or moving the selection on the canvas.
        Parameters:
        movementCursor - The movement cursor
